author: 0x1984
content: Yes, very stable at 29K for transfer. Itâ€™s intriguing that limit can surge that much

author: sky.cactus
content: It is entirely deterministic.  Any difference is an artifact of the contract being called.  Best to talk to the authors of the contract to better understand the difference.

author: _shemnon
content: Without a specific transaction we can only guess.  Like this guess.  Did the account have an existing balance?  For a typical token contract if the receiving address didn't have any token balance and receives a balance a storage slot will transition from zero to a new value, which is charged 20k extra gas, and would requires 49k gas if that's the only impact.  EIP-2200 covers all the cases on what to charge on specific storage cases.

author: 0x1984
content: Thanks! I followed <@301186049323958275> advice to contact ACX token devs directly and they gave out the same answer - extra gas needed to initialize account with non-prior ACX token balance. My transfer tax went out of gas limit with MetaMask which is how I noticed this - but surprised that MetaMask did not implement EIP-2200?

author: _shemnon
content: Metamask doesn't have an EVM, to my knowledge, so EIP-2200 wouldn't matter.  Not sure why the gas estimate was low.
